newsitem.title: UK: BA marketing executive joins Eurostar.
newsitem.headline: BA marketing executive joins Eurostar.

text.p: British Airways Plc confirmed on Sunday that a top marketing executive had quit to join London & Continental Railways (LCR), which operates the Eurostar service between London and continental Europe.

A British Airways spokesman said the company had sufficient management strength to cover the loss of Hamish Taylor, who as general manager of its airline brands had reported to marketing director Martin George.
"When you are the market leader, with the best people working for you, some will be poached and some will decide to move elsewhere to develop their careers further or faster," the spokesman said.
"But we have great depths of highly talented managers to make up."
Eurostar competes with BA services between London and Paris and Brussels.
No one at LCR, whose backers include the Virgin Group of arch-BA rival Richard Branson, was immediately available for comment.
A report in the Times newspaper quoted LCR chief executive Adam Mills as saying he was "delighted" with Taylor's appointment.
Taylor's "brand-building abilities in transport are...second to none", said Mills.
